body.p:
Per Costa Rica
Shanghae 12 September 1872
T. KROES & CIE
Shanghae
Messrs L. Kniffler +Co
Nagasaki
Dear Sirs!
We received yesterday your litel favor
of 8th instant and contents had our best atten-
tion with thanks for the information about
your market.
With regard to the Sample of railway
Cords we are sorry to say thet we did not
succeed to find any of it. We inquired as
well at foreign as at Chinese hongs but
none did know the article. We shall however
proceed with further inquiries and and if we
may find it we will send you at once a
telegram informing you about price, assortment,
quantitiy and length and health of the
prices.
We beg to hand you inclosed our Shanghae
Tradereport to which we take liberty to
refer an whick gives you all particulars
about our market till the 6th. The intervening
week has been characterised by extreme depres-
sion and weakness in the demand for plain cottons
and this in the face of telegrams advising

advancing prices in Liverpool and steady rates
in Manchester. This in fear that when the long
looked for demand does arrive the anxiety to
reduce stocks will neutralise the good effects
ordinarily produced by a more active business
and that we shall see a low range of prices during
the remainder of the season. Besides the long looked
for autumnal demand sums more remote now
than ever. It will certainly not conform Tientsin
unless by a special interoperation of Providence_
the misery comes by the prevailing floods is
as surged to a very extraordinary event_
and this appears very unlikely_
Yesterday there was some demand for shirtings
for Japan, but for which post we could not leave
The article has declined of fully 2 centimes
for price on common shops only. Dewhurst eagles
are nominally unchanged Since the date of our
report.
Black Velvets are also much wanted for Japan
but there are none to be met with here even
at the advanced prices of 3 mace per Yard
Drills are again lower but in fair demand still
London 6/ on bankbills 6/2 Credits ¼. 6/2 ½
On Japan there is noticed rate Mex Dollars 19.30
We remain, dear SirsYour faithfully
P. Maclean+Co
telegrams are send to Mr vol Pak
and we think he will have no objection
to let you have a look at them
